intro: Psomiocarpa aspidioides, commonly known as the horned fig. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae, native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like projections on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, spherical fruits. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
